alert.note: Alert for Knox (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 26 at 11:20AM EST until February 26 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... Cumberland River at Barbourville affecting Knox County. For the Cumberland River...including Cumberland, Baxter, Pineville, Barbourville, Williamsburg...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast to continue. * WHERE...Cumberland River at Barbourville. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Low lying roads flood. Manchester street floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Saturday the stage was 27.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EST Saturday was 29.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 5.0 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.8 feet on 04/14/1994. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued at 8 PM on Saturday, February 26th.
